text: Samira Hurem (born 14 November 1972) is a Bosnian retired professional footballer and current football manager. Since July 2010, she has been serving the position of head coach of Bosnian women's powerhouse SFK 2000. In the summer of 2011, she was named the new manager of the Bosnia and Herzegovina women's national football team. ==Honours== ===Player=== SFK 2000 *Bosnian Women's Premier League: 2002–03, 2003–04, 2004–05, 2005–06 *Bosnian Women's Cup: (2001–02 or 2002–03), 2003–04, 2005–06 ===Manager=== SFK 2000 *Bosnian Women's Premier League: 2010–11, 2011–12, 2012–13, 2013–14, 2014–15, 2015–16, 2016–17, 2017–18, 2018–19, 2019–20 *Bosnian Women's Cup: 2010–11, 2011–12, 2012–13, 2013–14, 2014–15, 2015–16, 2016–17, 2017–18, 2018–19 ===Individual=== *Bosnia and Herzegovina Manager of the Year: 2016 ==References== ==External links== *Samira Hurem at globalsportsarchive.com Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Bosnia and Herzegovina football managers Category:People from Sarajevo Category:Female association football managers Category:Bosniaks of Bosnia and Herzegovina
title: Samira Hurem
